message.content:
cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.MS, cs.NA, cs.PF

Reasoning: 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper discusses the design of a new weather and climate modelling system that is being developed to replace an existing system in preparation for exascale computing. The paper also discusses the use of parallel code and the performance of the system on different machine architectures, which are all relevant to distributed and parallel computing. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): The paper describes the design of the software infrastructure for the new modelling system, which follows object-oriented principles to facilitate modularity and the use of external libraries. The paper also discusses an application called PSyclone that generates parallel code, which is relevant to software engineering. 
- cs.MS (Mathematical Software): The paper discusses the use of a semi-structured cubed-sphere mesh and the GungHo dynamical core in the new modelling system, which are both relevant to mathematical software. 
- cs.NA (Numerical Analysis): The paper discusses the performance of the new modelling system on different machine architectures and the use of hybrid MPI/OpenMP, which are both relevant to numerical analysis. 
- cs.PF (Performance): The paper discusses the performance of the new modelling system on different machine architectures and the use of parallel code, which are both relevant to performance.
